step1.sentence: The athlete broke the national record by nearly two full seconds.

step2.story: The fundraising campaign broke every record the organization had set in its thirty-year history. What made it remarkable was not just the total amount but the number of first-time donors — people who had never given before and did so because a friend had told them to.

step3.story: She had been training for the marathon for eighteen months, rebuilding after a stress fracture had sidelined her for nearly a year. At the thirty-five kilometer mark, she checked her pace and understood that her personal best was in reach if she held it. She did not think about breaking a record. She thought about form, about breathing, about the next kilometer. The split time at the finish line was a personal best by four minutes. She found out she had broken the course record while sitting in a foil blanket eating a banana.

meaning.realUsageKo: 기존의 최고 기록을 넘어설 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: break는 여기서 초과하다, 뛰어넘다는 의미입니다. set a record(기록을 세우다)와 짝을 이룹니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 스포츠뿐만 아니라 판매, 속도, 규모 등 다양한 맥락에서 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: The new model broke every sales record in the first week.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 신모델이 첫 주에 모든 판매 기록을 깼어요.
